description: Participants will design and build a water rocket to achieve the highest altitude and maximum air time in the first round, and the greatest horizontal distance when launched at a 45-degree angle in the second round. Rockets must be constructed with safety in mind and adhere to the guidelines specified below.
structure: It is single round event where the team with best utilization of waste will be declared as winner. The student will pitch their creation in front of the panel.
eligibilities: Participants: Open to students from 8th to 12th grade.
Team Composition: Individuals or teams of up to four members.
Mentor Requirement: Each team must have at least one adult mentor or coach to guide the preparation and design of the rocket.
rules: Teams must set up their rockets and launch pads in the designated area before the start of their allotted time.
When ready to launch, teams must raise a “Ready to Launch” flag. Notify the referee if needed.
Teams have 5 minutes to prepare and launch their rocket. Exceeding this time limit will result in disqualification.
Round 1: Rockets landing outside the defined area will incur a 5-second deduction from the recorded air time.
Round 2: Rockets landing outside the designated field area will be disqualified from the distance measurement.
Safety is paramount. Rockets and launch pads must be designed to ensure the safety of participants and spectators.
The use of commercial kits or pre-made components is prohibited.
All design elements must be inspected and approved by the launch inspector before the competition.
